content.raw:
I think that these lines should check if values are finite before applying `precision`: #!/osrf/gazebo/src/ca2a71952a3823494afe2aafe9b6996c40e31539/gazebo/math/Vector3.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#Vector3.hh-326



Otherwise:

```

  math::Vector3 v=math::Vector3::Zero;
  v.z = std::numeric_limits<double>::max();
  std::cout << v << std::endl;

```



causes the following error:

```
terminate called after throwing an instance of 'boost::exception_detail::clone_impl<boost::exception_detail::error_info_injector<boost::math::rounding_error> >'
  what():  Error in function boost::math::round<d>(d): Value inf can not be represented in the target integer type.
Aborted (core dumped)

```
